solution_line_template: To have an average speed of {target_average_speed} mph over {total_time_needed} hours he needs to travel {target_average_speed}*{total_time_needed}=<<{target_average_speed}*{total_time_needed}={total_distance_needed}>>{total_distance_needed} miles.
He drove {initial_speed}*{initial_time}=<<{initial_speed}*{initial_time}={initial_distance_traveled}>>{initial_distance_traveled} miles in the first {initial_time} hours

He needs to travel another {total_distance_needed}-{initial_distance_traveled}=<<{total_distance_needed}-{initial_distance_traveled}={remaining_distance}>>{remaining_distance} miles over the next 2 hours.
His speed needs to be {remaining_distance}/{remaining_time}=<<{remaining_distance}/{remaining_time}={required_speed}>>{required_speed} mph
